Enum.name: INIT
Enum.description: Initialization CMD: 74 clock cycles for initialization sequence.

Enum.name: SYNC
Enum.description: Synchronized CMD: Wait for the end of the current data block transfer before sending the pending command.

Enum.name: CE_ATA
Enum.description: CE-ATA Completion Signal disable Command. The host cancels the ability for the device to return a command completion signal on the command line.

Enum.name: IT_CMD
Enum.description: Interrupt command: Corresponds to the Interrupt Mode (CMD40).

Enum.name: IT_RESP
Enum.description: Interrupt response: Corresponds to the Interrupt Mode (CMD40).

Enum.name: BOR
Enum.description: Boot Operation Request. Start a boot operation mode, the host processor can read boot data from the MMC device directly.

Enum.name: EBO
Enum.description: End Boot Operation. This command allows the host processor to terminate the boot operation mode.

BitField.name: MAXLAT
BitField.description: Max Latency for Command to Response

Enum.name: COMPLETION
Enum.description: This bit indicates that a completion signal is expected within a programmed amount of time (HSMCI_CSTOR).

BitField.name: BCNT
BitField.description: MMC/SDIO Block Count - SDIO Byte Count

BitField.name: CMDRDY
BitField.description: Command Ready (cleared by writing in HSMCI_CMDR)

BitField.name: TXRDY
BitField.description: Transmit Ready (cleared by writing in HSMCI_TDR)

BitField.name: DTIP
BitField.description: Data Transfer in Progress (cleared at the end of CRC16 calculation)

BitField.name: SDIOIRQA
BitField.description: SDIO Interrupt for Slot A (cleared on read)

BitField.name: CSRCV
BitField.description: CE-ATA Completion Signal Received (cleared on read)

BitField.name: RINDE
BitField.description: Response Index Error (cleared by writing in HSMCI_CMDR)

BitField.name: RDIRE
BitField.description: Response Direction Error (cleared by writing in HSMCI_CMDR)

BitField.name: RCRCE
BitField.description: Response CRC Error (cleared by writing in HSMCI_CMDR)

BitField.name: RENDE
BitField.description: Response End Bit Error (cleared by writing in HSMCI_CMDR)

BitField.name: RTOE
BitField.description: Response Time-out Error (cleared by writing in HSMCI_CMDR)

BitField.name: CSTOE
BitField.description: Completion Signal Time-out Error (cleared on read)

BitField.name: BLKOVRE
BitField.description: DMA Block Overrun Error (cleared on read)

BitField.name: ACKRCV
BitField.description: Boot Operation Acknowledge Received (cleared on read)

BitField.name: ACKRCVE
BitField.description: Boot Operation Acknowledge Error (cleared on read)

BitField.name: OVRE
BitField.description: Overrun (if FERRCTRL = 1, cleared by writing in HSMCI_CMDR or cleared on read if FERRCTRL = 0)

BitField.name: UNRE
BitField.description: Underrun (if FERRCTRL = 1, cleared by writing in HSMCI_CMDR or cleared on read if FERRCTRL = 0)

BitField.name: DTIP
BitField.description: Data Transfer in Progress Interrupt Enable

BitField.name: SDIOIRQA
BitField.description: SDIO Interrupt for Slot A Interrupt Enable

BitField.name: SDIOWAIT
BitField.description: SDIO Read Wait Operation Status Interrupt Enable

BitField.name: RENDE
BitField.description: Response End Bit Error Interrupt Enable

BitField.name: CSTOE
BitField.description: Completion Signal Timeout Error Interrupt Enable

BitField.name: BLKOVRE
BitField.description: DMA Block Overrun Error Interrupt Enable

BitField.name: DTIP
BitField.description: Data Transfer in Progress Interrupt Disable

BitField.name: SDIOIRQA
BitField.description: SDIO Interrupt for Slot A Interrupt Disable

BitField.name: SDIOWAIT
BitField.description: SDIO Read Wait Operation Status Interrupt Disable

BitField.name: RENDE
BitField.description: Response End Bit Error Interrupt Disable

BitField.name: CSTOE
BitField.description: Completion Signal Time out Error Interrupt Disable

BitField.name: BLKOVRE
BitField.description: DMA Block Overrun Error Interrupt Disable

BitField.name: DTIP
BitField.description: Data Transfer in Progress Interrupt Mask

BitField.name: SDIOIRQA
BitField.description: SDIO Interrupt for Slot A Interrupt Mask

BitField.name: SDIOWAIT
BitField.description: SDIO Read Wait Operation Status Interrupt Mask

BitField.name: RENDE
BitField.description: Response End Bit Error Interrupt Mask

BitField.name: CSTOE
BitField.description: Completion Signal Time-out Error Interrupt Mask

BitField.name: BLKOVRE
BitField.description: DMA Block Overrun Error Interrupt Mask

BitField.name: ACKRCV
BitField.description: Boot Operation Acknowledge Received Interrupt Mask

BitField.name: ACKRCVE
BitField.description: Boot Operation Acknowledge Error Interrupt Mask

BitField.name: CHKSIZE
BitField.description: DMA Channel Read and Write Chunk Size

BitField.name: FERRCTRL
BitField.description: Flow Error flag reset control mode

Enum.name: PASSWD
Enum.description: Writing any other value in this field aborts the write operation of the WPEN bit.Always reads as 0.

BitField.description: Data to Read or Data to Write

Enum.name: NONE
Enum.description: None, RK pin is an input

Enum.name: CONTINUOUS
Enum.description: Continuous Receive Clock, RK pin is an output

Enum.name: TRANSFER
Enum.description: Receive Clock only during data transfers, RK pin is an output

Enum.name: EN_RF_LOW
Enum.description: Receive Clock enabled only if RF Low

Enum.name: EN_RF_HIGH
Enum.description: Receive Clock enabled only if RF High

Enum.name: CONTINUOUS
Enum.description: Continuous, as soon as the receiver is enabled, and immediately after the end of transfer of the previous data.

Enum.name: RF_LOW
Enum.description: Detection of a low level on RF signal

Enum.name: RF_HIGH
Enum.description: Detection of a high level on RF signal

Enum.name: RF_FALLING
Enum.description: Detection of a falling edge on RF signal

Enum.name: RF_RISING
Enum.description: Detection of a rising edge on RF signal

Enum.name: RF_LEVEL
Enum.description: Detection of any level change on RF signal

Enum.name: RF_EDGE
Enum.description: Detection of any edge on RF signal

Enum.name: NONE
Enum.description: None, RF pin is an input

Enum.name: NEGATIVE
Enum.description: Negative Pulse, RF pin is an output

Enum.name: POSITIVE
Enum.description: Positive Pulse, RF pin is an output

Enum.name: LOW
Enum.description: Driven Low during data transfer, RF pin is an output

Enum.name: HIGH
Enum.description: Driven High during data transfer, RF pin is an output

Enum.name: TOGGLING
Enum.description: Toggling at each start of data transfer, RF pin is an output

Enum.name: NONE
Enum.description: None, TK pin is an input

Enum.name: CONTINUOUS
Enum.description: Continuous Transmit Clock, TK pin is an output

Enum.name: TRANSFER
Enum.description: Transmit Clock only during data transfers, TK pin is an output

Enum.name: EN_TF_LOW
Enum.description: Transmit Clock enabled only if TF Low

Enum.name: EN_TF_HIGH
Enum.description: Transmit Clock enabled only if TF High

Enum.name: CONTINUOUS
Enum.description: Continuous, as soon as a word is written in the SSC_THR (if Transmit is enabled), and immediately after the end of transfer of the previous data

Enum.name: TF_LOW
Enum.description: Detection of a low level on TF signal

Enum.name: TF_HIGH
Enum.description: Detection of a high level on TF signal

Enum.name: TF_FALLING
Enum.description: Detection of a falling edge on TF signal

Enum.name: TF_RISING
Enum.description: Detection of a rising edge on TF signal

Enum.name: TF_LEVEL
Enum.description: Detection of any level change on TF signal

Enum.name: TF_EDGE
Enum.description: Detection of any edge on TF signal

Enum.name: NONE
Enum.description: None, TF pin is an input

Enum.name: NEGATIVE
Enum.description: Negative Pulse, TF pin is an output

Enum.name: POSITIVE
Enum.description: Positive Pulse, TF pin is an output

Enum.name: TOGGLING
Enum.description: Toggling at each start of data transfer

Enum.name: PASSWD
Enum.description: Writing any other value in this field aborts the write operation of the WPEN bit.Always reads as 0.

BitField.name: RDRF
BitField.description: Receive Data Register Full (cleared by reading SPI_RDR)

BitField.name: TDRE
BitField.description: Transmit Data Register Empty (cleared by writing SPI_TDR)

BitField.name: TXEMPTY
BitField.description: Transmission Registers Empty (cleared by writing SPI_TDR)

BitField.name: UNDES
BitField.description: Underrun Error Status (Slave mode only) (cleared on read)

BitField.name: RDRF
BitField.description: Receive Data Register Full Interrupt Enable

BitField.name: TDRE
BitField.description: SPI Transmit Data Register Empty Interrupt Enable

BitField.name: RDRF

Enum.name: DISABLE_SW_PROT
Enum.description: Disables the software write protection of the register groups of which the bit WPRGx is at '1'.

Enum.name: ENABLE_SW_PROT
Enum.description: Enables the software write protection of the register groups of which the bit WPRGx is at '1'.

Enum.name: ENABLE_HW_PROT
Enum.description: Enables the hardware write protection of the register groups of which the bit WPRGx is at '1'. Only a hardware reset of the PWM controller can disable the hardware write protection. Moreover, to meet security requirements, the PIO lines associated with the PWM can not be configured through the PIO interface.

Enum.description: Writing any other value in this field aborts the write operation of the WPCMD field.Always reads as 0

Register.name: MCAN0_FBTP
Register.description: Fast Bit Timing and Prescaler Register

BitField.name: FTSEG2
BitField.description: Fast Time Segment After Sample Point

BitField.name: FTSEG1
BitField.description: Fast Time Segment Before Sample Point

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Reset value. Loop Back mode is disabled.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Loop Back mode is enabled (see Section 1.5.1.9).

Enum.name: RESET
Enum.description: Reset value, CANTX controlled by the CAN Core, updated at the end of the CAN bit time.

Enum.name: SAMPLE_POINT_MONITORING
Enum.description: Sample Point can be monitored at pin CANTX.

Enum.name: PROTECTED
Enum.description: The processor has no write access to the protected configuration registers.

Enum.name: CONFIGURABLE
Enum.description: The processor has write access to the protected configuration registers (while MCAN_CCCR.INIT = '1').

BitField.name: ASM
BitField.description: Restricted Operation Mode (read/write, write protection against '1')

Enum.name: CLOCK_STOP
Enum.description: Clock stop requested. When clock stop is requested, first INIT and then CSA will be set after all pend-ing transfer requests have been completed and the CAN bus reached idle.

BitField.name: MON
BitField.description: Bus Monitoring Mode (read/write, write protection against '1')

Enum.name: AUTO_RETX
Enum.description: Automatic retransmission of messages not transmitted successfully enabled.

BitField.name: TEST
BitField.description: Test Mode Enable (read/write, write protection against '1')

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Normal operation, MCAN_TEST register holds reset values.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Test mode, write access to MCAN_TEST register enabled.

Enum.name: ISO11898_1
Enum.description: CAN operation according to ISO11898-1 enabled

Enum.name: FD_BITRATE_SWITCH
Enum.description: Request CAN FD operation with bit rate switching

Enum.name: TCP_INC
Enum.description: Timestamp counter value incremented according to TCP

Enum.name: TX_EV_TIMEOUT
Enum.description: Timeout controlled by Tx Event FIFO

BitField.name: LEC
BitField.description: Last Error Code (set to 111 on read)

Enum.name: NO_ERROR
Enum.description: No error occurred since LEC has been reset by successful reception or transmission.

Enum.name: STUFF_ERROR
Enum.description: More than 5 equal bits in a sequence have occurred in a part of a received message where this is not allowed.

Enum.name: FORM_ERROR
Enum.description: A fixed format part of a received frame has the wrong format.

Enum.name: ACK_ERROR
Enum.description: The message transmitted by the MCAN was not acknowledged by another node.

Enum.name: BIT1_ERROR
Enum.description: During the transmission of a message (with the exception of the arbitration field), the device wanted to send a recessive level (bit of logical value '1'), but the monitored bus value was dominant.

Enum.name: BIT0_ERROR
Enum.description: During the transmission of a message (or acknowledge bit, or active error flag, or overload flag), the device wanted to send a dominant level (data or identifier bit logical value '0'), but the monitored bus value was recessive. During Bus_Off recovery this status is set each time a sequence of 11 recessive bits has been monitored. This enables the processor to monitor the proceeding of the Bus_Off recovery sequence (indicating the bus is not stuck at dominant or continuously disturbed).

Enum.name: CRC_ERROR
Enum.description: The CRC check sum of a received message was incorrect. The CRC of an incoming message does not match with the CRC calculated from the received data.

Enum.name: NO_CHANGE
Enum.description: Any read access to the Protocol Status Register re-initializes the LEC to '7'. When the LEC shows the value '7', no CAN bus event was detected since the last processor read access to the Protocol Status Register.

Enum.name: SYNCHRONIZING
Enum.description: Node is synchronizing on CAN communication

Enum.name: IDLE
Enum.description: Node is neither receiver nor transmitter

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Reset value. Loop Back mode is disabled.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Loop Back mode is enabled (see Section 1.5.1.9).

Enum.name: RESET
Enum.description: Reset value, CANTX controlled by the CAN Core, updated at the end of the CAN bit time.

Enum.name: SAMPLE_POINT_MONITORING
Enum.description: Sample Point can be monitored at pin CANTX.

Enum.name: PROTECTED
Enum.description: The processor has no write access to the protected configuration registers.

Enum.name: CONFIGURABLE
Enum.description: The processor has write access to the protected configuration registers (while MCAN_CCCR.INIT = '1').

BitField.name: ASM
BitField.description: Restricted Operation Mode (read/write, write protection against '1')

Enum.name: CLOCK_STOP
Enum.description: Clock stop requested. When clock stop is requested, first INIT and then CSA will be set after all pend-ing transfer requests have been completed and the CAN bus reached idle.

BitField.name: MON
BitField.description: Bus Monitoring Mode (read/write, write protection against '1')

Enum.name: AUTO_RETX
Enum.description: Automatic retransmission of messages not transmitted successfully enabled.

BitField.name: TEST
BitField.description: Test Mode Enable (read/write, write protection against '1')

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Normal operation, MCAN_TEST register holds reset values.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Test mode, write access to MCAN_TEST register enabled.

Enum.name: ISO11898_1
Enum.description: CAN operation according to ISO11898-1 enabled

Enum.name: FD_BITRATE_SWITCH
Enum.description: Request CAN FD operation with bit rate switching

Enum.name: TCP_INC
Enum.description: Timestamp counter value incremented according to TCP

Enum.description: Timeout controlled by Tx Event FIFO

Enum.name: HOST
Enum.description: The module is in USB Host mode.

Enum.name: DEVICE
Enum.description: The module is in USB Device mode.

BitField.name: RDERRI
BitField.description: Remote Device Connection Error Interrupt (Host mode only)

BitField.name: RDERRIC
BitField.description: Remote Device Connection Error Interrupt Clear

BitField.name: RDERRIS
BitField.description: Remote Device Connection Error Interrupt Set

Enum.name: DIS
Enum.description: Hardware triggers are disabled. Starting a conversion is only possible by software.

Enum.name: EN
Enum.description: Hardware trigger selected by TRGSEL field is enabled.

Enum.name: AFEC_TRIG0
Enum.description: AFE0_ADTRG for AFEC0 / AFE1_ADTRG for AFEC1

Enum.name: AFEC_TRIG1
Enum.description: TIOA Output of the Timer Counter Channel 0 for AFEC0/TIOA Output of the Timer Counter Channel 3 for AFEC1

Enum.name: AFEC_TRIG2
Enum.description: TIOA Output of the Timer Counter Channel 1 for AFEC0/TIOA Output of the Timer Counter Channel 4 for AFEC1

Enum.name: AFEC_TRIG3
Enum.description: TIOA Output of the Timer Counter Channel 2 for AFEC0/TIOA Output of the Timer Counter Channel 5 for AFEC1

Enum.name: AFEC_TRIG4
Enum.description: PWM0 event line 0 for AFEC0 / PWM1 event line 0 for AFEC1

Enum.name: AFEC_TRIG5
Enum.description: PWM0 event line 1 for AFEC0 / PWM1 event line 1 for AFEC1

Enum.name: NORMAL
Enum.description: Normal mode: The AFE and reference voltage circuitry are kept ON between conversions.

Enum.name: SLEEP
Enum.description: Sleep mode: The AFE and reference voltage circuitry are OFF between conversions.

Enum.name: OFF
Enum.description: Normal Sleep mode: The sleep mode is defined by the SLEEP bit.

Enum.name: ON
Enum.description: Fast wake-up Sleep mode: The voltage reference is ON between conversions and AFE is OFF.

Enum.name: ON
Enum.description: Free Run mode: Never wait for any trigger.

Enum.name: NUM_ORDER
Enum.description: Normal mode: The controller converts channels in a simple numeric order.

Enum.name: REG_ORDER
Enum.description: User Sequence mode: The sequence respects what is defined in AFEC_SEQ1R and AFEC_SEQ1R.

Enum.name: LOW
Enum.description: Generates an event when the converted data is lower than the low threshold of the window.

Enum.name: HIGH
Enum.description: Generates an event when the converted data is higher than the high threshold of the window.

Enum.name: IN
Enum.description: Generates an event when the converted data is in the comparison window.

Enum.name: OUT
Enum.description: Generates an event when the converted data is out of the comparison window.

Enum.name: NO_AVERAGE
Enum.description: 12-bit resolution, AFE sample rate is maximum (no averaging).

Enum.name: OSR4
Enum.description: 13-bit resolution, AFE sample rate divided by 4 (averaging).

Enum.name: OSR16
Enum.description: 14-bit resolution, AFE sample rate divided by 16 (averaging).

Enum.name: OSR64
Enum.description: 15-bit resolution, AFE sample rate divided by 64 (averaging).

Enum.name: OSR256
Enum.description: 16-bit resolution, AFE sample rate divided by 256 (averaging).

Enum.name: SE_UNSG_DF_SIGN
Enum.description: Single-Ended channels: Unsigned conversions.Differential channels: Signed conversions.

Enum.name: SE_SIGN_DF_UNSG
Enum.description: Single-Ended channels: Signed conversions.Differential channels: Unsigned conversions.

BitField.name: EOC0
BitField.description: End of Conversion 0 (cleared by reading AFEC_CDRx)

BitField.name: EOC1
BitField.description: End of Conversion 1 (cleared by reading AFEC_CDRx)

BitField.name: EOC2
BitField.description: End of Conversion 2 (cleared by reading AFEC_CDRx)

BitField.name: EOC11

BitField.name: GOVRE
BitField.description: General Overrun Error (cleared by reading AFEC_ISR)

Enum.name: LOW
Enum.description: Generates an event when the converted data is lower than the low threshold of the window.

Enum.name: HIGH
Enum.description: Generates an event when the converted data is higher than the high threshold of the window.

Enum.name: IN
Enum.description: Generates an event when the converted data is in the comparison window.

Enum.name: OUT
Enum.description: Generates an event when the converted data is out of the comparison window.

Enum.name: PASSWD
Enum.description: Writing any other value in this field aborts the write operation of the WPEN bit. Always reads as 0.

Enum.name: TRIG_EVENT
Enum.description: External trigger mode or Free-running mode enabled. (See TRGENx.DACC_TRIGR.)

Enum.name: TRIG_EVENT
Enum.description: External trigger mode or Free-running mode enabled. (See TRGENx.DACC_TRIGR.)

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: One data to convert is written to the FIFO per access to DACC.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Two data to convert are written to the FIFO per access to DACC (reduces the number of requests to DMA and the number of system bus accesses).

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: DAC0 and DAC1 are single-ended outputs.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: DACP and DACN are differential outputs. The differential level is configured by the channel 0 value.

BitField.name: PRESCALER
BitField.description: Peripheral Clock to DAC Clock Ratio

Enum.name: DIS
Enum.description: External trigger mode disabled. DACC is in Free-running mode or Max speed mode.

Enum.name: DIS
Enum.description: External trigger mode disabled. DACC is in Free-running mode or Max speed mode.

Enum.name: PASSWD
Enum.description: Writing any other value in this field aborts the write operation of bit WPEN.Always reads as 0.

Enum.name: RISING
Enum.description: Only rising edge of comparator output

Enum.name: DIS
Enum.description: Analog comparator output is directly processed.

Enum.name: EN
Enum.description: Analog comparator output is inverted prior to being processed.

Enum.name: CE
Enum.description: The CE flag is used to drive the FAULT output.

Enum.name: OUTPUT
Enum.description: The output of the analog comparator flag is used to drive the FAULT output.

Enum.name: DIS
Enum.description: The FAULT output is tied to 0.

Enum.name: EN
Enum.description: The FAULT output is driven by the signal defined by SELFS.

Enum.name: PASSWD
Enum.description: Writing any other value in this field aborts the write operation of the WPEN bit.Always reads as 0.

Enum.name: DISABLE_SW_PROT
Enum.description: Disables the software write protection of the register groups of which the bit WPRGx is at '1'.

Enum.name: ENABLE_SW_PROT
Enum.description: Enables the software write protection of the register groups of which the bit WPRGx is at '1'.

Enum.name: ENABLE_HW_PROT
Enum.description: Enables the hardware write protection of the register groups of which the bit WPRGx is at '1'. Only a hardware reset of the PWM controller can disable the hardware write protection. Moreover, to meet security requirements, the PIO lines associated with the PWM can not be configured through the PIO interface.

Enum.name: PASSWD
Enum.description: Writing any other value in this field aborts the write operation of the WPEN bit.Always reads as 0

Enum.name: DIS
Enum.description: Hardware triggers are disabled. Starting a conversion is only possible by software.

Enum.name: EN
Enum.description: Hardware trigger selected by TRGSEL field is enabled.

Enum.name: AFEC_TRIG0
Enum.description: AFE0_ADTRG for AFEC0 / AFE1_ADTRG for AFEC1

Enum.name: AFEC_TRIG1
Enum.description: TIOA Output of the Timer Counter Channel 0 for AFEC0/TIOA Output of the Timer Counter Channel 3 for AFEC1

Enum.name: AFEC_TRIG2
Enum.description: TIOA Output of the Timer Counter Channel 1 for AFEC0/TIOA Output of the Timer Counter Channel 4 for AFEC1

Enum.name: AFEC_TRIG3
Enum.description: TIOA Output of the Timer Counter Channel 2 for AFEC0/TIOA Output of the Timer Counter Channel 5 for AFEC1

Enum.name: AFEC_TRIG4
Enum.description: PWM0 event line 0 for AFEC0 / PWM1 event line 0 for AFEC1

Enum.name: AFEC_TRIG5
Enum.description: PWM0 event line 1 for AFEC0 / PWM1 event line 1 for AFEC1

Enum.name: NORMAL
Enum.description: Normal mode: The AFE and reference voltage circuitry are kept ON between conversions.

Enum.name: SLEEP
Enum.description: Sleep mode: The AFE and reference voltage circuitry are OFF between conversions.

Enum.name: OFF
Enum.description: Normal Sleep mode: The sleep mode is defined by the SLEEP bit.

Enum.name: ON
Enum.description: Fast wake-up Sleep mode: The voltage reference is ON between conversions and AFE is OFF.

Enum.name: ON
Enum.description: Free Run mode: Never wait for any trigger.

Enum.name: NUM_ORDER
Enum.description: Normal mode: The controller converts channels in a simple numeric order.

Enum.name: REG_ORDER
Enum.description: User Sequence mode: The sequence respects what is defined in AFEC_SEQ1R and AFEC_SEQ1R.

Enum.name: LOW
Enum.description: Generates an event when the converted data is lower than the low threshold of the window.

Enum.name: HIGH
Enum.description: Generates an event when the converted data is higher than the high threshold of the window.

Enum.name: IN
Enum.description: Generates an event when the converted data is in the comparison window.

Enum.name: OUT
Enum.description: Generates an event when the converted data is out of the comparison window.

Enum.name: NO_AVERAGE
Enum.description: 12-bit resolution, AFE sample rate is maximum (no averaging).

Enum.name: OSR4
Enum.description: 13-bit resolution, AFE sample rate divided by 4 (averaging).

Enum.name: OSR16
Enum.description: 14-bit resolution, AFE sample rate divided by 16 (averaging).

Enum.name: OSR64
Enum.description: 15-bit resolution, AFE sample rate divided by 64 (averaging).

Enum.name: OSR256
Enum.description: 16-bit resolution, AFE sample rate divided by 256 (averaging).

Enum.name: SE_UNSG_DF_SIGN
Enum.description: Single-Ended channels: Unsigned conversions.Differential channels: Signed conversions.

Enum.name: SE_SIGN_DF_UNSG
Enum.description: Single-Ended channels: Signed conversions.Differential channels: Unsigned conversions.

Enum.name: INACTIVE
Enum.description: AES_IDATARx cannot be written during processing of previous block.

Enum.name: ACTIVE
Enum.description: AES_IDATARx can be written during processing of previous block when SMOD = 2. It speeds up the overall runtime of large files.

Enum.name: PASSWD
Enum.description: This field must be written with 0xE to allow CMTYPx bit configuration changes. Any other values will abort the write operation in CMTYPx bits.Always reads as 0.

Enum.name: SRC_PARAMS_UPDATED
Enum.description: Source parameters are updated when the descriptor is retrieved.

Enum.name: MEM_TRAN
Enum.description: Self triggered mode (Memory to Memory Transfer).

Enum.name: PER_TRAN
Enum.description: Synchronized mode (Peripheral to Memory or Memory to Peripheral Transfer).

Enum.name: SINGLE
Enum.description: The memory burst size is set to one.

Enum.name: FOUR
Enum.description: The memory burst size is set to four.

Enum.name: EIGHT
Enum.description: The memory burst size is set to eight.

Enum.name: SIXTEEN
Enum.description: The memory burst size is set to sixteen.

Enum.name: HWR_CONNECTED
Enum.description: Hardware request line is connected to the peripheral request line.

Enum.name: SWR_CONNECTED
Enum.description: Software request is connected to the peripheral request line.

BitField.name: MEMSET
BitField.description: Channel x Fill Block of memory

Enum.name: HW_MODE
Enum.description: Sets the block of memory pointed by DA field to the specified value. This operation is performed on 8, 16 or 32 bits basis.

Enum.name: BYTE
Enum.description: The data size is set to 8 bits

Enum.name: HALFWORD
Enum.description: The data size is set to 16 bits

Enum.name: WORD
Enum.description: The data size is set to 32 bits

Enum.name: AHB_IF0
Enum.description: The data is read through the system bus interface 0.

Enum.name: AHB_IF1
Enum.description: The data is read through the system bus interface 1.

Enum.name: AHB_IF0
Enum.description: The data is written through the system bus interface 0.

Enum.name: AHB_IF1
Enum.description: The data is written though the system bus interface 1.

Enum.name: INCREMENTED_AM
Enum.description: The addressing mode is incremented (the increment size is set to the data size).

Enum.name: UBS_AM
Enum.description: The microblock stride is added at the microblock boundary.

Enum.name: UBS_DS_AM
Enum.description: The microblock stride is added at the microblock boundary, the data stride is added at the data boundary.

Enum.name: INCREMENTED_AM
Enum.description: The addressing mode is incremented (the increment size is set to the data size).

Enum.name: UBS_AM
Enum.description: The microblock stride is added at the microblock boundary.

Enum.name: UBS_DS_AM
Enum.description: The microblock stride is added at the microblock boundary, the data stride is added at the data boundary.

BitField.name: INITD
BitField.description: Channel Initialization Terminated (this bit is read-only)

BitField.name: RDIP
BitField.description: Read in Progress (this bit is read-only)

Enum.name: DONE
Enum.description: No Active read transaction on the bus.

Enum.name: IN_PROGRESS
Enum.description: A read transaction is in progress.

BitField.name: WRIP
BitField.description: Write in Progress (this bit is read-only)

Enum.name: DONE
Enum.description: No Active write transaction on the bus.

Enum.name: IN_PROGRESS
Enum.description: A Write transaction is in progress.

BitField.description: Channel x Peripheral Hardware Request Line Identifier

Enum.name: SPI
Enum.description: The QSPI is in SPI mode.

Enum.name: MEMORY
Enum.description: The QSPI is in Serial Memory mode.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: No effect. In SPI mode, a transfer can be initiated whatever the state of the QSPI_RDR is.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: In SPI mode, a transfer can start only if the QSPI_RDR is empty, i.e., does not contain any unread data. This mode prevents overrun error in reception.

Enum.name: NOT_RELOADED
Enum.description: The chip select is deasserted if QSPI_TDR.TD has not been reloaded before the end of the current transfer.

Enum.name: LASTXFER
Enum.description: The chip select is deasserted when the bit LASTXFER is written at 1 and the character written in QSPI_TDR.TD has been transferred.

Enum.name: SYSTEMATICALLY
Enum.description: The chip select is deasserted systematically after each transfer.

BitField.name: RDRF
BitField.description: Receive Data Register Full Interrupt Enable

BitField.name: TDRE
BitField.description: Transmit Data Register Empty Interrupt Enable

BitField.name: RDRF
BitField.description: Receive Data Register Full Interrupt Disable

BitField.name: TDRE
BitField.description: Transmit Data Register Empty Interrupt Disable

BitField.name: RDRF
BitField.description: Receive Data Register Full Interrupt Mask

BitField.name: TDRE
BitField.description: Transmit Data Register Empty Interrupt Mask

BitField.name: WIDTH
BitField.description: Width of Instruction Code, Address, Option Code and Data

Enum.name: SINGLE_BIT_SPI
Enum.description: Instruction: Single-bit SPI / Address-Option: Single-bit SPI / Data: Single-bit SPI

Enum.name: DUAL_OUTPUT
Enum.description: Instruction: Single-bit SPI / Address-Option: Single-bit SPI / Data: Dual SPI

Enum.name: QUAD_OUTPUT
Enum.description: Instruction: Single-bit SPI / Address-Option: Single-bit SPI / Data: Quad SPI

Enum.name: DUAL_IO
Enum.description: Instruction: Single-bit SPI / Address-Option: Dual SPI / Data: Dual SPI

Enum.name: QUAD_IO
Enum.description: Instruction: Single-bit SPI / Address-Option: Quad SPI / Data: Quad SPI

Enum.name: DUAL_CMD
Enum.description: Instruction: Dual SPI / Address-Option: Dual SPI / Data: Dual SPI

Enum.name: QUAD_CMD
Enum.description: Instruction: Quad SPI / Address-Option: Quad SPI / Data: Quad SPI

Enum.name: OPTION_1BIT
Enum.description: The option code is 1 bit long.

Enum.name: OPTION_2BIT
Enum.description: The option code is 2 bits long.

Enum.name: OPTION_4BIT
Enum.description: The option code is 4 bits long.

Enum.name: OPTION_8BIT
Enum.description: The option code is 8 bits long.

Enum.name: TRSFR_READ
Enum.description: Read transfer from the serial memory.Scrambling is not performed.Read at random location (fetch) in the serial Flash memory is not possible.

Enum.name: TRSFR_READ_MEMORY
Enum.description: Read data transfer from the serial memory.If enabled, scrambling is performed.Read at random location (fetch) in the serial Flash memory is possible.

Enum.name: TRSFR_WRITE
Enum.description: Write transfer into the serial memory.Scrambling is not performed.

Enum.name: TRSFR_WRITE_MEMORY
Enum.description: Write data transfer into the serial memory.If enabled, scrambling is performed.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: The Continuous Read mode is disabled.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: The Continuous Read mode is enabled.

Enum.name: PASSWD
Enum.description: Writing any other value in this field aborts the write operation of the WPEN bit. Always reads as 0.

BitField.description: NCS Setup Length in WRITE Access

BitField.description: NCS Setup Length in READ Access

Enum.description: Byte select access type:- Write operation is controlled using NCS, NWE, NBS0, NBS1.- Read operation is controlled using NCS, NRD, NBS0, NBS1.

Enum.name: BYTE_WRITE
Enum.description: Byte write access type:- Write operation is controlled using NCS, NWR0, NWR1.- Read operation is controlled using NCS and NRD.

Enum.description: Byte write access type:- Write operation is controlled using NCS, NWR0, NWR1.- Read operation is controlled using NCS and NRD.

Enum.name: BYTE_SELECT
Enum.description: Byte select access type:- Write operation is controlled using NCS, NWE, NBS0, NBS1.- Read operation is controlled using NCS, NRD, NBS0, NBS1.

Enum.name: BYTE_WRITE
Enum.description: Byte write access type:- Write operation is controlled using NCS, NWR0, NWR1.- Read operation is controlled using NCS and NRD.

BitField.name: KEY1
BitField.description: Off Chip Memory Scrambling (OCMS) Key Part 1

BitField.name: KEY2
BitField.description: Off Chip Memory Scrambling (OCMS) Key Part 2

Enum.name: PASSWD
Enum.description: Writing any other value in this field aborts the write operation of the WPEN bit. Always reads as 0.

Enum.name: NORMAL
Enum.description: Normal mode. Any access to the SDRAM is decoded normally. To activate this mode, command must be followed by a write to the SDRAM.

Enum.name: NOP
Enum.description: The SDRAMC issues a NOP command when the SDRAM device is accessed regardless of the cycle. To activate this mode, command must be followed by a write to the SDRAM.

Enum.name: ALLBANKS_PRECHARGE
Enum.description: The SDRAMC issues an "All Banks Precharge" command when the SDRAM device is accessed regardless of the cycle. To activate this mode, command must be followed by a write to the SDRAM.

Enum.name: LOAD_MODEREG
Enum.description: The SDRAMC issues a "Load Mode Register" command when the SDRAM device is accessed regardless of the cycle. To activate this mode, command must be followed by a write to the SDRAM.

Enum.name: AUTO_REFRESH
Enum.description: The SDRAMC issues an "Auto-Refresh" Command when the SDRAM device is accessed regardless of the cycle. Previously, an "All Banks Precharge" command must be issued. To activate this mode, command must be followed by a write to the SDRAM.

Enum.name: EXT_LOAD_MODEREG
Enum.description: The SDRAMC issues an "Extended Load Mode Register" command when the SDRAM device is accessed regardless of the cycle. To activate this mode, the "Extended Load Mode Register" command must be followed by a write to the SDRAM. The write in the SDRAM must be done in the appropriate bank; most low-power SDRAM devices use the bank 1.

Enum.name: DEEP_POWERDOWN
Enum.description: Deep power-down mode. Enters deep power-down mode.

BitField.name: TRC_TRFC
BitField.description: Row Cycle Delay and Row Refresh Cycle

BitField.name: TXSR
BitField.description: Exit Self Refresh to Active Delay

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Low Power Feature is inhibited: no Power-down, Self-refresh or Deep Power-down command is issued to the SDRAM device.

Enum.name: SELF_REFRESH
Enum.description: The SDRAMC issues a Self-refresh command to the SDRAM device, the SDCK clock is deactivated and the SDCKE signal is set low. The SDRAM device leaves the Self Refresh Mode when accessed and enters it after the access.

Enum.name: POWER_DOWN
Enum.description: The SDRAMC issues a Power-down Command to the SDRAM device after each access, the SDCKE signal is set to low. The SDRAM device leaves the Power-down Mode when accessed and enters it after the access.

Enum.name: DEEP_POWER_DOWN
Enum.description: The SDRAMC issues a Deep Power-down command to the SDRAM device. This mode is unique to low-power SDRAM.

BitField.name: PASR
BitField.description: Partial Array Self-refresh (only for low-power SDRAM)

BitField.name: TCSR
BitField.description: Temperature Compensated Self-Refresh (only for low-power SDRAM)

BitField.name: TIMEOUT
BitField.description: Time to Define When Low-power Mode Is Enabled

Enum.name: LP_LAST_XFER
Enum.description: The SDRAMC activates the SDRAM low-power mode immediately after the end of the last transfer.

Enum.name: LP_LAST_XFER_64
Enum.description: The SDRAMC activates the SDRAM low-power mode 64 clock cycles after the end of the last transfer.

Enum.name: LP_LAST_XFER_128
Enum.description: The SDRAMC activates the SDRAM low-power mode 128 clock cycles after the end of the last transfer.

BitField.name: TMRD
BitField.description: Load Mode Register Command to Active or Refresh Command

Enum.name: UNLTD_LENGTH
Enum.description: Unlimited Length Burst-No predicted end of burst is generated, therefore INCR bursts coming from this master can only be broken if the Slave Slot Cycle Limit is reached. If the Slot Cycle Limit is not reached, the burst is normally completed by the master, at the latest, on the next AHB 1-Kbyte address boundary, allowing up to 256-beat word bursts or 128-beat double-word bursts.This value should not be used in the very particular case of a master capable of performing back-to-back undefined length bursts on a single slave, since this could indefinitely freeze the slave arbitration and thus prevent another master from accessing this slave.

Enum.name: SINGLE_ACCESS
Enum.description: Single Access-The undefined length burst is treated as a succession of single accesses, allowing re-arbitration at each beat of the INCR burst or bursts sequence.

Enum.name: 4BEAT_BURST
Enum.description: 4-beat Burst-The undefined length burst or bursts sequence is split into 4-beat bursts or less, allowing re-arbitration every 4 beats.

Enum.name: 8BEAT_BURST
Enum.description: 8-beat Burst-The undefined length burst or bursts sequence is split into 8-beat bursts or less, allowing re-arbitration every 8 beats.

Enum.name: 16BEAT_BURST
Enum.description: 16-beat Burst-The undefined length burst or bursts sequence is split into 16-beat bursts or less, allowing re-arbitration every 16 beats.

Enum.name: 32BEAT_BURST
Enum.description: 32-beat Burst -The undefined length burst or bursts sequence is split into 32-beat bursts or less, allowing re-arbitration every 32 beats.

Enum.name: 64BEAT_BURST
Enum.description: 64-beat Burst-The undefined length burst or bursts sequence is split into 64-beat bursts or less, allowing re-arbitration every 64 beats.

Enum.name: 128BEAT_BURST
Enum.description: 128-beat Burst-The undefined length burst or bursts sequence is split into 128-beat bursts or less, allowing re-arbitration every 128 beats.

Enum.name: 128BEAT_BURST
Enum.description: 128-beat Burst-The undefined length burst or bursts sequence is split into 128-beat bursts or less, allowing re-arbitration every 128 beats.

Enum.name: UNLTD_LENGTH
Enum.description: Unlimited Length Burst-No predicted end of burst is generated, therefore INCR bursts coming from this master can only be broken if the Slave Slot Cycle Limit is reached. If the Slot Cycle Limit is not reached, the burst is normally completed by the master, at the latest, on the next AHB 1-Kbyte address boundary, allowing up to 256-beat word bursts or 128-beat double-word bursts.This value should not be used in the very particular case of a master capable of performing back-to-back undefined length bursts on a single slave, since this could indefinitely freeze the slave arbitration and thus prevent another master from accessing this slave.

Enum.name: SINGLE_ACCESS
Enum.description: Single Access-The undefined length burst is treated as a succession of single accesses, allowing re-arbitration at each beat of the INCR burst or bursts sequence.

Enum.name: 4BEAT_BURST
Enum.description: 4-beat Burst-The undefined length burst or bursts sequence is split into 4-beat bursts or less, allowing re-arbitration every 4 beats.

BitField.name: SLOT_CYCLE
BitField.description: Maximum Bus Grant Duration for Masters

Enum.name: NONE
Enum.description: No Default Master-At the end of the current slave access, if no other master request is pending, the slave is disconnected from all masters.This results in a one clock cycle latency for the first access of a burst transfer or for a single access.

Enum.name: LAST
Enum.description: Last Default Master-At the end of the current slave access, if no other master request is pending, the slave stays connected to the last master having accessed it.This results in not having one clock cycle latency when the last master tries to access the slave again.

Enum.name: FIXED
Enum.description: Fixed Default Master-At the end of the current slave access, if no other master request is pending, the slave connects to the fixed master the number that has been written in the FIXED_DEFMSTR field.This results in not having one clock cycle latency when the fixed master tries to access the slave again.

Enum.name: STOP_VREG
Enum.description: If KEY is correct, VROFF asserts the vddcore_nreset and stops the voltage regulator.

Enum.name: CRYSTAL_SEL
Enum.description: If KEY is correct, XTALSEL switches the slow clock on the crystal oscillator output.

Enum.name: PASSWD
Enum.description: Writing any other value in this field aborts the write operation.

Register.name: SUPC_SMMR
Register.description: Supply Controller Supply Monitor Mode Register

Enum.name: 32SLCK
Enum.description: Supply Monitor enabled one SLCK period every 32 SLCK periods

Enum.name: 256SLCK
Enum.description: Supply Monitor enabled one SLCK period every 256 SLCK periods

Enum.name: 2048SLCK
Enum.description: Supply Monitor enabled one SLCK period every 2,048 SLCK periods

Enum.name: NOT_ENABLE
Enum.description: The core reset signal vddcore_nreset is not affected when a supply monitor detection occurs.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: The core reset signal, vddcore_nreset is asserted when a supply monitor detection occurs.

Enum.name: NOT_ENABLE
Enum.description: The SUPC interrupt signal is not affected when a supply monitor detection occurs.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: The SUPC interrupt signal is asserted when a supply monitor detection occurs.

Enum.name: NOT_ENABLE
Enum.description: The core reset signal vddcore_nreset is not affected when a brownout detection occurs.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: The core reset signal, vddcore_nreset is asserted when a brownout detection occurs.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: The core brownout detector is enabled.

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: The core brownout detector is disabled.

Enum.name: ONREG_UNUSED
Enum.description: Internal voltage regulator is not used (external power supply is used).

Enum.name: NO_EFFECT
Enum.description: No effect. Clock selection depends on the value of XTALSEL (SUPC_CR).

Enum.name: BYPASS
Enum.description: The 32 kHz crystal oscillator is bypassed if XTALSEL (SUPC_CR) is set. OSCBYPASS must be set prior to setting XTALSEL.

Enum.name: PASSWD
Enum.description: Writing any other value in this field aborts the write operation.

Enum.name: NOT_ENABLE
Enum.description: The supply monitor detection has no wake-up effect.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: The supply monitor detection forces the wake-up of the core power supply.

Enum.name: NOT_ENABLE
Enum.description: The RTT alarm signal has no wake-up effect.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: The RTT alarm signal forces the wake-up of the core power supply.

Enum.name: NOT_ENABLE
Enum.description: The RTC alarm signal has no wake-up effect.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: The RTC alarm signal forces the wake-up of the core power supply.

Enum.name: NOT_ENABLE
Enum.description: The WKUP0 input pin is not connected to the low-power debouncer.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: The WKUP0 input pin is connected to the low-power debouncer and forces a system wake-up.

Enum.name: NOT_ENABLE
Enum.description: The WKUP1 input pin is not connected to the low-power debouncer.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: The WKUP1 input pin is connected to the low-power debouncer and forces a system wake-up.

Enum.name: NOT_ENABLE
Enum.description: A low-power debounce event does not create an immediate clear on the first half of GPBR registers.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: A low-power debounce event on WKUP0 or WKUP1 generates an immediate clear on the first half of GPBR registers.

Enum.name: IMMEDIATE
Enum.description: Immediate, no debouncing, detected active at least on one Slow Clock edge.

Enum.name: 3_SLCK
Enum.description: WKUPx shall be in its active state for at least 3 SLCK periods

Enum.name: 32_SLCK
Enum.description: WKUPx shall be in its active state for at least 32 SLCK periods

Enum.name: 512_SLCK
Enum.description: WKUPx shall be in its active state for at least 512 SLCK periods

Enum.name: 4096_SLCK
Enum.description: WKUPx shall be in its active state for at least 4,096 SLCK periods

Enum.name: 32768_SLCK
Enum.description: WKUPx shall be in its active state for at least 32,768 SLCK periods

Enum.name: 2_RTCOUT
Enum.description: WKUP0/1 in active state for at least 2 RTCOUTx clock periods

Enum.name: 3_RTCOUT
Enum.description: WKUP0/1 in active state for at least 3 RTCOUTx clock periods

Enum.name: 4_RTCOUT
Enum.description: WKUP0/1 in active state for at least 4 RTCOUTx clock periods

Enum.name: 5_RTCOUT
Enum.description: WKUP0/1 in active state for at least 5 RTCOUTx clock periods

Enum.name: 6_RTCOUT
Enum.description: WKUP0/1 in active state for at least 6 RTCOUTx clock periods

Enum.name: 7_RTCOUT
Enum.description: WKUP0/1 in active state for at least 7 RTCOUTx clock periods

Enum.name: 8_RTCOUT
Enum.description: WKUP0/1 in active state for at least 8 RTCOUTx clock periods

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: The corresponding wake-up input has no wake-up effect.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: The corresponding wake-up input is enabled for a wake-up of the core power supply.

Enum.name: NO
Enum.description: No wake-up due to the assertion of the WKUP pins has occurred since the last read of SUPC_SR.

Enum.name: PRESENT
Enum.description: At least one wake-up due to the assertion of the WKUP pins has occurred since the last read of SUPC_SR.

BitField.name: SMWS
BitField.description: Supply Monitor Detection Wake-up Status (cleared on read)

Enum.name: NO
Enum.description: No wake-up due to a supply monitor detection has occurred since the last read of SUPC_SR.

Enum.name: PRESENT
Enum.description: At least one wake-up due to a supply monitor detection has occurred since the last read of SUPC_SR.

BitField.name: BODRSTS
BitField.description: Brownout Detector Reset Status (cleared on read)

Enum.name: NO
Enum.description: No core brownout rising edge event has been detected since the last read of the SUPC_SR.

Enum.name: PRESENT
Enum.description: At least one brownout output rising edge event has been detected since the last read of the SUPC_SR.

BitField.name: SMRSTS
BitField.description: Supply Monitor Reset Status (cleared on read)

Enum.name: NO
Enum.description: No supply monitor detection has generated a core reset since the last read of the SUPC_SR.

Enum.name: PRESENT
Enum.description: At least one supply monitor detection has generated a core reset since the last read of the SUPC_SR.

Enum.name: NO
Enum.description: No supply monitor detection since the last read of SUPC_SR.

Enum.name: PRESENT
Enum.description: At least one supply monitor detection since the last read of SUPC_SR.

Enum.name: HIGH
Enum.description: The supply monitor detected VDDIO higher than its threshold at its last measurement.

Enum.name: LOW
Enum.description: The supply monitor detected VDDIO lower than its threshold at its last measurement.

Enum.name: RC
Enum.description: The slow clock, SLCK, is generated by the embedded 32 kHz RC oscillator.

Enum.name: CRYST
Enum.description: The slow clock, SLCK, is generated by the 32 kHz crystal oscillator.

BitField.name: LPDBCS0
BitField.description: Low-power Debouncer Wake-up Status on WKUP0 (cleared on read)

Enum.name: NO
Enum.description: No wake-up due to the assertion of the WKUP0 pin has occurred since the last read of SUPC_SR.

Enum.name: PRESENT
Enum.description: At least one wake-up due to the assertion of the WKUP0 pin has occurred since the last read of SUPC_SR.

BitField.name: LPDBCS1
BitField.description: Low-power Debouncer Wake-up Status on WKUP1 (cleared on read)

Enum.name: NO
Enum.description: No wake-up due to the assertion of the WKUP1 pin has occurred since the last read of SUPC_SR.

Enum.name: PRESENT
Enum.description: At least one wake-up due to the assertion of the WKUP1 pin has occurred since the last read of SUPC_SR.

Enum.name: DIS
Enum.description: The corresponding wake-up input is disabled, or was inactive at the time the debouncer triggered a wake-up event.

Enum.name: EN
Enum.description: The corresponding wake-up input was active at the time the debouncer triggered a wake-up event since the last read of SUPC_SR.

Enum.description: Month change (every 01 of each month at time 00:00:00)

Enum.name: UPDATE
Enum.description: Time and calendar registers can be updated.

Enum.name: ALARMEVENT
Enum.description: An alarm matching condition has occurred.

Enum.name: NO_SECEVENT
Enum.description: No second event has occurred since the last clear.

Enum.description: At least one second event has occurred since the last clear.

Enum.name: NO_TIMEVENT
Enum.description: No time event has occurred since the last clear.

Enum.name: TIMEVENT

Enum.name: NO_CALEVENT

Enum.description: At least one calendar event has occurred since the last clear.

BitField.name: TDERR
BitField.description: Time and/or Date Free Running Error

Enum.name: CORRECT
Enum.description: The internal free running counters are carrying valid values since the last read of the Status Register (RTC_SR).

Enum.name: ERR_TIMEDATE
Enum.description: The internal free running counters have been corrupted (invalid date or time, non-BCD values) since the last read and/or they are still invalid.

BitField.name: TDERRCLR

BitField.name: TDERREN
BitField.description: Time and/or Date Error Interrupt Enable

BitField.name: TDERRDIS
BitField.description: Time and/or Date Error Interrupt Disable

Enum.description: The baud rate is driven by the peripheral clock

BitField.name: RELOAD
BitField.description: Value to load into the SYST_CVR when the counter is enabled and when it reaches 0

BitField.name: CURRENT
BitField.description: The current value of the SysTick counter

BitField.name: NOREF
BitField.description: Indicates whether the device provides a reference clock to the processor

BitField.name: SKEW
BitField.description: Indicates whether the TENMS value is exact

BitField.name: TENMS
BitField.description: Reload value for 10ms (100Hz) timing, subject to system clock skew errors

BitField.name: DISDYNADD
BitField.description: Disables dynamic allocation of ADD and SUB instructions

BitField.name: DISISSCH1
BitField.description: Indicates instruction type might not be issued in channel 1

BitField.name: DISDI
BitField.description: Indicates nothing can be dual-issued when this instruction type is in channel 0

BitField.name: DISBTACALLOC
BitField.description: Indicates no new entries are allocated in BTAC, but existing entries can be updated

BitField.name: DISBTACREAD
BitField.description: Indicates BTAC is not used and only static branch prediction can occur

BitField.name: DISITMATBFLUSH
BitField.description: Disables ITM and DWT ATB flush

BitField.name: DISRAMODE
BitField.description: Disables dynamic read allocate mode for Write-Back Write-Allocate memory regions

BitField.name: VECTPENDING
BitField.description: Indicates the exception number of the highest priority pending enabled exception

BitField.name: RETTOBASE
BitField.description: Indicates whether there are preempted active exceptions

Register.name: AIRCR
Register.description: Application Interrupt and Reset Control Register

BitField.name: SLEEPDEEP
BitField.description: Controls whether the processor uses sleep or deep sleep as its low power mode

BitField.name: SLEEPONEXIT
BitField.description: Indicates sleep-on-exit when returning from Handler mode to Thread mode

BitField.name: STKALIGN
BitField.description: Indicates stack alignment on exception entry

BitField.name: BFHFNMIGN
BitField.description: Enables handlers with priority -1 or-2 to ignore data BusFaults caused by load and store instructions

BitField.name: DIV_0_TRP
BitField.description: Enables faulting or halting when the processor executes an SDIVor UDIV instruction with a divisor of 0

BitField.name: USERSETMPEND
BitField.description: Enables unprivileged software access to the STIR

BitField.name: NONBASETHRDENA
BitField.description: Indicates how the processor enters Thread mode

Register.name: SHCSR
Register.description: System Handler Control and State Register

BitField.name: MMARVALID
BitField.description: MemManage Fault Address Register(MMFAR) valid flag

BitField.name: MLSPERR
BitField.description: Indicates a MemManage fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation

BitField.name: MSTKERR
BitField.description: MemManage fault on stacking for exception entry

BitField.name: MUNSTKERR
BitField.description: MemManage fault on unstacking for a return from exception

BitField.name: LSPERR
BitField.description: Indicates a bus fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation

BitField.name: STKERR
BitField.description: BusFault on stacking for exception entry

BitField.name: UNSTKERR
BitField.description: BusFault on unstacking for a return from exception

BitField.name: INVPC
BitField.description: Invalid PC load UsageFault, causedby an invalid PC load by EXC_RETURN

BitField.name: FORCED
BitField.description: Indicates a forced hard fault, generated by escalation of a fault with configurable priority that cannot be handled, either because of priority or because it is disabled

BitField.name: VECTTBL
BitField.description: Indicates a BusFault on a vectortable read during exception processing

BitField.name: ADDRESS
BitField.description: When the MMARVALID bit of the MMFSR is set to 1, this field holds the address of the location that generated the MemManage fault

BitField.name: ADDRESS
BitField.description: When the BFARVALID bit of the BFSR is set to1, this field holds the address of the location that generated the BusFault

BitField.name: IMPDEF
BitField.description: Implementation defined, the bits map to the AUXFAULT input signals

BitField.name: ADDRESSS
BitField.description: The location of the unpopulated floating-point register space allocated on an exception stack frame

BitField.name: IREGION
BitField.description: Number of supported MPU instruction regions

BitField.name: DREGION
BitField.description: Number of supported MPU data regions

BitField.name: SEPARATE
BitField.description: Support for unified or separate instruction and date memory maps

BitField.name: PRIVDEFENA
BitField.description: Enables privileged software access to the default memory map

BitField.name: HFNMIENA
BitField.description: Enable the operation of MPU during hard fault, NMI, and FAULTMASK handlers

BitField.name: REGION
BitField.description: Indicates the MPU region referenced by the MPU_RBAR and MPU_RASR registers

Register.name: MPU_RASR
Register.description: MPU Region Attribute and Size Register
